prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Tapered Middle Section The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top and bottom sections are parallel to each other, while the middle section is perpendicular to both. The top and bottom sections are connected to the middle section by two smaller rectangles. The object is centered in the image. Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0366, 0.0] Sketching the First Face Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw the first face as follows: 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.2271, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.2271, 0.0] to point [0.5859, 0.0]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.5859, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.1699]. 5. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.1699] to point [0.4263, 0.1699]. 6. Draw a line from point [0.4263, 0.1699] to point [0.4263, 0.2051]. 7. Draw a line from point [0.4263, 0.2051] to point [0.3237, 0.2051]. 8. Draw a line from point [0.3237, 0.2051] to point [0.3237, 0.1699]. 9. Draw a line from point [0.3237, 0.1699] to point [0.0, 0.1699]. 10. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.1699] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Creating the Loops 1. For Loop 1, select the following lines in order: line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4, line\\_5, line\\_6, line\\_7, line\\_8, line\\_9, line\\_10. 2. For Loop 2, select the following lines in order: line\\_11, line\\_12, line\\_13, line\\_14. 3. For Loop 3, select the following lines in order: line\\_15, line\\_16, line\\_17, line\\_18. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch in the normal direction with a depth of 0.0366. The resulting part is the first part of the assembly, and it has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 m - Width: 0.0366 m - Height: 0.75 m</description>

<description>Part 1: Creating the First Rectangular Prism Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch**: Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. **Create Face 1**: Draw the rectangle by creating the following lines and loops: - Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0547) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.0547) to (0.0, 0.0547) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.0547) to (0.0, 0.0) The rectangle formed will have dimensions of 0.75 (length) x 0.0547 (width), and will be located at the origin of the coordinate system. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch**: The scaled 2D sketch will be transformed into a 3D sketch and extruded into a 3D model using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0234 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body. Part 2: Building the Second Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Construct a simple, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is slightly tapered at the top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch**: Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. **Create Face 1**: Draw the rectangle by creating the following lines and loops: - Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0547) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.0547) to (0.0, 0.0547) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.0547) to (0.0, 0.0) The rectangle formed will have dimensions of 0.75 (length) x 0.0547 (width), and will be located at the origin of the coordinate system. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**: This step is not necessary for this part, as there is no specified scaling factor for this prism. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch**: The scaled 2D sketch will be transformed into a 3D sketch and extruded into a 3D model using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0234 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Join and add material to the previous part. This forms a single, tapered, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. In the sketch, create a circle (circle\\_1) in the positive quadrant: - Center: [0.0079, 0.0079] - Radius: 0.0079 Close the loop by connecting the end of the arc to the start point. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0158. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Extrude the 3D sketch through a depth of 0.75 (towards the positive Z direction). **Part 2: Modify the long, thin, cylindrical object** Create a new coordinate system for part 2, similar to the one in part 1, but with slightly different parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0014, 0.75, 0.0014] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. In the sketch, create a circle (circle\\_1) in the positive quadrant: - Center: [0.0064, 0.0064] - Radius: 0.0064 Close the loop by connecting the end of the arc to the start point. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0129. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Subtract the newly created volume from the existing cylindrical object. The resulting CAD model should be a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end and a groove on one side. Based on the provided description, the dimensions are: - Height: 0.0158 m (part 1 height + part 2 height after the operation) - Width: 0.75 m - Length: 0.0158 m (part 1 length = part 2 length)</description>

<description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Central Hole The first part is a cylindrical object with a central hole, having a flat top and bottom. The overall height of the object is slightly more than its diameter.Let's get started: 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.045, 0.0] 2. **Generate 2D sketch on the XY plane**: 2.1. Create the top face of the object: - Draw circle `circle_1` with Center at [0.375, 0.375] and Radius: 0.375 - This circle forms `loop_1` and `face_1` 2.2. Create the central hole: - Draw circle `circle_1` with Center at [0.375, 0.375] and Radius: 0.12 - This circle forms `loop_2` under the same `face_1` 3. **Transform 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using given scaling and transformation**: 3.1. Apply scaling using the `sketch_scale` factor: 0.75 3.2. Apply Euler angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 3.3. Apply translation vector: 0.0, 0.045, 0.0 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D Model**: 4.1. Extrude `face_1` towards the normal direction with a depth of 0.0225. 4.2. Extrude `face_1` in the opposite direction of the normal with the same depth of 0.0225. 4.3. This results in a new body: the cylindrical object with a central hole and a flat top and bottom. The height of the object is 0.75, slightly more than its diameter. Now you have completed the first part, the cylindrical object with a central hole having a flat top and bottom. With this information, you should be able to generate the accurate CAD model according to the given CAD Assembly JSON. Follow these instructions to build the subsequent parts, making sure to create unique coordinate systems for each part. Next section: [Construct the final shape](https://www.example.com/cad-instructions-part-2). Confidence: 95%</description>

<description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has the following dimensions: 0.75 x 0.2161 x 0.75 (length, width, height). Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.2161, 0.0) Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw a rectangle with the following dimensions: * Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.4651) * Line 3: (0.75, 0.4651) to (0.0, 0.4651) * Line 4: (0.0, 0.4651) to (0.0, 0.0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the sketch using the scaling parameter of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.2161 (towards the normal) to create a 3D model of the prism. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The cylindrical object has the following dimensions: 0.0859 x 0.0859 x 0.2161 (length, width, height). Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, 180.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0639, 0.1394, 0.0) Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw a circle with the following properties: * Center: (0.043, 0.043) * Radius: 0.043 Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the sketch using the scaling parameter of 0.0859. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.2161 (towards the opposite direction of normal) to create a 3D model of the cylindrical object. For the final shape, use the outline of the prism and the cylindrical object, and combine them using a join operation. The final shape should have the following dimensions: 2 x 1 x 0.5 (length, width, height).</description>
